website_summaries.verdict: A popular wireless gaming headset with an unusual design.
pros: This wireless USB headset is designed with gamers in mind, from its comfortable memory foam ear cushions to its futuristic design
While there’s no noise cancellation, these headphones have the look and feel of a more expensive model
Customers praise the built-in sound chip and overall sound quality, as well as the passive noise cancellation the ear cups provide
cons: Battery life tends to taper off over time

customer_reviews.title: ... your self a favor do not buy this worked great when i first got the head set but did ...
customer_reviews.text: Do your self a favor do not buy this worked great when i first got the head set but did not know it had mic issues now the mic stopped working and no matter what i do i can not get it to work again. Its not the hardware its Corsair's horrible drivers. I used to be a big fan Corsair but after this purchase i think ill start looking at others before i come back here.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Owner of Pros and Standard Wireless, Here Are My Thoughts
customer_reviews.text: Both the Void Pro and Void Wireless are great headsets. I sold my void wireless to a friend and got the void pros, here are my thoughts: Positive +Better ergonomics than standard Void +Slightly better range than standard Void Wireless +Slightly better sound quality than standard Void Wireless +Improved mic over standard void wireless Neutral -similar battery life -updated aesthetics Negative -still slightly heavy not sure if worth the premium over the price I paid initially for void wireless, at least they will likely last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: My old 30$ headphones had much better sound. The sound for games like cs is ...
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price at all. My old 30$ headphones had much better sound. The sound for games like cs is muffled and weird. you cant hear footsteps well, i've tried messing with the eq settings and it still sound like crap.
customer_reviews.author: Brinny K.

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I really like this headset except for one thing
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I really like this headset except for one thing. When I got it,i charged it before using, then played it for 5 hours. After trying to recharge it for 9 hours it never got a full charge. Amazon sent me a new one, but I had the same issue with that one as well. I have just resigned myself not to try different headset, because I believe it won't solve the problem. I just hope the battery lasts for a couple of years and doesn't die on me in a couple of months. I would have given it 5 stars otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mordred

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Me and couple friends all bought this Headset, they have had problems off and on but last night it worked fine I turned it off connected it to charge, got on today and it will Not power up ! I tried connecting it to another pc and a USB plug both, also tried a different Power cord .. Nothing, it didn't drop fall or have any reason to not work. Owned it les than 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphones Ever
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 14+ Hour battery life (More with LED's off) Comfortable Cool Looking Amazon wireless range 40+ feet I could walk out to my car and back with no issues the only thing that I found disrupts the headsets signal is if I stand by the microwave while it is running. Overall really good headset. Cons: Sometimes the light when charging the battery does not change to green to show it's full. To fix this you have to fully drain the headset then charge it to 100%.
customer_reviews.author: seanne waguespack

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is pretty decent for the price, but I do find it just a tab lacking. For gaming however, I'm not to concerned about perfect sound quality. Just the precision of it, which this headset nails. Very comfy, and super light weight. I can wear this for 2 hours no problem. Mic quality is really good, I'm told, I speak very quietly but have no problem being heard. The range gets a bit limited when too many obstructions are involved. The battery life is insane on this thing and I love it. I charge it once every 1-2 weeks when using for varying times, 1-4 hours a day, sometimes daily but at least 4-5 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: 5 star wireless headset!
customer_reviews.text: I simply love this headset and it's high quality. The clarity, (Both mic and sound accuracy are exceptional.) Everyone says not to buy a wireless gaming headset. Oh well... They are wrong because I can game 7 hours on a charge with this unit and the range and clarity are better than my previous $200 wired gaming headset!!!!! This is awesome! I stay connected vocally when I'm 200 feet away while I'm pouring a cocktail between gaming rounds while still in full communication. I like that:) Rock on baby!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, loose fit
customer_reviews.text: I only had these for a few days before I decided to return them. The audio quality was good, and I had no issues getting the headset set up on Windows 10 (I've had some nightmares dealing with bluetooth on windows so I was trying to avoid getting a bluetooth headset). Unfortunately the deal breaker for me was how loose fitting the headset was. I'd like to think I have a normal sized head, but bending over slightly caused the headset to shift. It got too annoying for me (since I'll frequently get up and walk around). I decided to return them for something else that fits better.
customer_reviews.author: Well Put

customer_reviews.title: Nice start, but not great long-term.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a while now (~a year, a little longer). Was perfect for a while. Over time, there's lots of stuttering, lots of random issues with discord connection, sometimes brief but loud (almost painfully loud) sounds of static. I recommended this to 2 friends and almost regret doing so because the headset fits well and looks great visually, but the random audible issues (this is a HEADSET after all) are really a bummer when spending this much on a single item that's manufactured in Taiwan.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and great mic for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived right on time with Amazon's own delivery van being tracked with a map and time to delivery. Sweet !!! I love the product - the mic works great with noise cancelling (no ambient noise). The battery lasts most all day, and iCue software shows how much charge is left. The headset feels quite rugged, but comfortable to my head.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thacker

customer_reviews.title: At least it lasted 9 months...
customer_reviews.text: I bout this product January 28th 2019, It was great until a month ago in September when it started screwing the incoming sound. It will randomly throw static over the sound of whatever I am watching or playing. Sadely I am unsure on how it happened but it is safely stowed after each use and I can only assume that the product is merely inferior. I would return it if possible but it says I am passed my time so looks like they just made money off a bad product. I know its electronic but it should atleast last a year minimum. Sad as it is quite expensive. I will not be buying another Corsair product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Surround mode squashes volume
customer_reviews.text: I had some audio crackling and disconnecting issues before, but I moved the wireless transmitter away from other USB devices and it got better. The surround sound mode drops the volume on louder noises, making music much less dynamic in terms of its volume. I prefer listening with the surround off because of this. The bass wasn't strong enough on the default equalizer setting. Build quality is nice. Battery life is fine. Comfort is fine, fits my big head even not on its biggest setting. Doesn't insulate much sound.
customer_reviews.author: Tobey

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless headset for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Best bang for your buck in my opinion. Wireless is very good and keeps signal from me going upstairs and downstairs. The mic sounds OK, really not bad for being wireless. Sound is great again, for a wireless system. I really cant say much for surround sound, I only used stereo. The fit is VERY loose. I don't think my head is small (7.5 baseball hat size), and I couldn't even look down at my shoes without the headset falling off. They are very comfortable though, I consistently used these for 5-9 hours in a gaming session without any fatigue. If you need a wireless system I would choose these over other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Artie Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Huge Headset Bad Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: This headset must be made for people with giant heads. It is extremely uncomfortable and slid right off my head if I looked down at all. I had to wear a hat for the headphones to fit right. The sound quality was nothing special, very similar to every other gaming headset on the market. Too much bass so the in-game sounds are drowned out which makes it impossible to hear footsteps and sound queues at all. Battery when from 100% to 30% in about 2 hours. I'm not sure if I just got a bad pair but I ended up returning these. There are much better products out there in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: mitch

customer_reviews.title: Sound fantastic,wouldnt buy again though.
customer_reviews.text: These were incredible .....when they worked.Had them for a month and a half before the battery error messages started.Corsair support is great but these headphones just don't keep a charge as long as stated either but not too shabby cause it charges fast.Make sure you plug it up to charge in a usb 3.1 or 3.0 or it will give you error messages. In the end it's way too much of a hassle and problems with the headphones for the amount of money i paid
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Rip the flesh from the veil of existence with CORSAIR VOID PRO.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. They are SUPER comfortable. A bit loose around the ears (yes you can “tighten” the headset size but they sit loose still) but it’s fine. Makes it less pressing on your lobes. Sound is good. Wish the icue software had more presets for audio. Mic lifts up and down, shut off when upward. The volume and two buttons are simple and clean. That’s the way that you’re making me feel tonight, it’s hard to let it go. Hold me. Whatever lies beyond this morning, it’s a little later on. Regardless of earning the future doesn’t scare me at all. Nothing’s like before.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Way too large. Won't work for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: I can't honestly review the sound quality, mic, or any other feature of these headphones because they were absolutely enormous. I had them on the smallest size setting but they were still just resting on top of my head so if I moved at all, they slid right off. The top of the ear covers crushed the tops of my ears and they barely even grazed the side of my head. So if you're not a fully grown adult male, this headset will likely not work for you either. I'm an adult female with a very average-sized head but had to return this product immediately because it was ridiculously huge. What a lame oversight on Corsair's part.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Decent battery charge hold, good mic quality. The audio isn't as good as with noise-cancelling headsets, but still pretty decent. Static and white noise randomly happens when I use the headset to listen to music or play games, but Corsair requires that I send it back to them before sending out a replacement, and as this is my only headset, I can't really go for a week or more without it. Edit: was stupid enough to go through Corsair support instead of simply returning the headset. 3 weeks and $12 for shipping later, I finally have a normally functioning headset. Very disappointed with Corsair's customer service, which was incredibly annoying and frustrating to interact with.
customer_reviews.author: ALG

customer_reviews.title: Same model, different product build quality.
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit the same as my previous set of Corsair Void Pro RGB wireless headset. The earcups do not fit snugly on this new set, and they slip around on my head. I have no idea why they changed them, as the set that I had (that broke) fit just fine. I'm too late to return these, which is my fault, but I'm so fed up with them already that I've ordered a different model entirely. Don't waste your money on this headset. As much as I love Corsair products in general, these just aren't worth the $60-70 asking price. It's really a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Mic is great. Headphones are great. Lights don't have as many functions as I excepted but no biggie. I don't really care to have lights running that I can't see. Battery lasts a solid amount of time. It let's me know to charge while playing, I grab the micro USB, it let's me know when finished, so convenient. Headphones do not stay in place while doing pushups. A nonissue. I forget I'm wearing headphones due to comfort and thanks to wireless I just stand up and no tugging cables. Fantastic product. No complaints that matter. Have been recommending to friends. Would buy again if they break.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Busch II

customer_reviews.title: Not designed to fit all sizes
customer_reviews.text: This headset seems really nice but it is adjusted all the way down and still doesn't accommodate my female head. This was my first gaming headset and I didn't realize some headsets don't adjust down small enough for an average woman's head. I wish I could exchange for something else that fits. They are so big that they rest on the tips of my ears and start to hurt not to mention when I turn my head they wobble.
customer_reviews.author: jamiex110

customer_reviews.title: ******Ignore other reviews*******
customer_reviews.text: ******Ignore other reviews******* There appears to be some sort of defamation campaign going on with these. So many people say they are junk and they are actually really really good. The sound is perfect headphones fit perfect and the microphone sounds super clear and nice! When i bought these i read all of these comments and was thinking crap i just messed up buying these.. No the issues these people describe are not true. seriously great wireless headphones. you can charge them while you play even if they are dead you can still charge them and use them... I dont know why someone said you couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: ryan mcmahan

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled at first, and then...
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy - at first. Great sound, awesome noise cancelling ability, and features I adored and wanted in a headset. My only complaint right out of the box was that it was a bit big and therefore loose and sloppy on my smaller sized noggin. 6 months later? VERY un-happy! Dongle began to give out, then all of a sudden, the Corsair dashboard states that the headset isn't plugged in at all. Sound just up and quit on me out of the clear blue sky. Complete uninstall and reinstall did nothing. No matter what I did I couldn't get them to work. WASTE OF MONEY ***VERY UNHAPPY!***
customer_reviews.author: Oriana

customer_reviews.title: Awesome if yours works
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable headset that's easy to adjust. Sound quality of the mic is better than expected for the price as is the sound. I can't give a full 5 stars because I ordered this and the first one had a bad mic that wouldn't unmute. I had to pay $12 to send back the product for a new one for a warranty claim. As a customer I hate companies that charge their customers for their QA issues.
customer_reviews.author: TruSpadez

customer_reviews.title: Careful for defected product
customer_reviews.text: Afer spending an hour on 'best' budget gaming headsets online, I arrived at this decently rated, good looking, and budget headset. However... 1) Completely stopped turning on after 1-2 months of use 2) While it worked, took 3-5 minutes for its microphone to 'warmup' and kick into use. For example, I switch back and forth from pc speakers to this headset all the time, and everytime when I switch it will have a lag time before its microphone can be used. I owned few other headsets throughout my life but this has never happened
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.

customer_reviews.title: The bad outweighs the good.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones look cosmetically awesome. Easy, customizable lighting and easy adjustment. However, the bottom of the war cups sit off of your head, making for an awkward and uncomfortable fit. The microphone does not transmit high quality voice, so others may not be able to understand you at all times. The sound quality is subpar, and bass is severely lacking. Also, these are NOT soundproofing, especially because they will most likely not create a full-seal over your ear. Overall, would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Logan D.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got these because i loved the old model(1500). The wireless is nice and the surround sound is amazing. I originally had the hissing and feedback but once I put it on my usb hub and not directly to the mobo, the sound cleared right up. I get about 6 hours of battery life which is more than enough. The software is nice and easy to use. Just an overall amazing quality. I drop them regularly and they have help up. Microphone also seems to be pretty good which is why i bought them. Plus they are extremely comfortable. The mesh/cloth ear pieces feel really nice. Just overall nothing short of amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Remarkable501

customer_reviews.title: Great for people wearing RIC hearing aids
customer_reviews.text: I use RIC (receiver-in-canal) hearing aids and it's hard to find headphones that won't give feedback. I was looking for headphones with a microphone so I can take phone calls and although this is a game headphone, it's works very well with phone calls, webinars and my RICs. The only issue I have is that sometimes I need to press the on/off button several times to turn it on. I can't review how well this product works for gaming, but it's a really good headphone for people with RIC hearing aids.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I got these on sale for about $70 and really wish I could say they were worth it. Unfortunately, this headset will blast you with white noise and static consistently. On top of that, even with the LED light off, it still drains the battery extremely quickly. As for build quality, it's not exactly great either. Sound quality is average at best. Do yourself a favor, save a bit of extra cash and get yourself a Steelseries Arctis 7 or PRO headset. That's what I did after I returned these. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Tashigi

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: My friend told me about these and it's been a year since i've bought them. I'm a gamer and i've used them for hundreds of hours including those in virtual reality. They have a RGB light on the side that can be adjusted through an app, just like razor products. The microphone is very accessible with a flip feature for muting and unmuting and also side panel buttons as well. Its very essy to setup, plug in the dongle and download the driver, and the dongle will act as the headset's nluetooth reciever. If your a gamer and don't want to break your bank on a headset, then I would recommend picking one of these up and trying it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Nothing great but acceptable for price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they seemed to be the best deal around the price point I was looking at for 7.1 headphones, didn't need a microphone or wireless either. Turns out 7.1 is a sales gimmick that does the same thing a stereo headphone will do. Overall if your looking to use the wireless and microphone features as well this is probably OK for the price point. I use a studio microphone and wireless is of no value to me so I'll be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working for no apparent reason after less than 8 months. It won't charge. won't come on.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I just plugged it in and it worked. It was easy to use. I could play games and talk to family and friends happily. It did not fit my head the best way, slid around a lot and hurt my ears after a gaming session. All in all, I was pleased enough with it. I'm a long time customer of Corsair .. memory and such, so I was sure the brand would be great and bought with confidence. I'm disgruntled that I have to go research for another headset.
customer_reviews.author: Dansnbear

customer_reviews.title: Best headset I've used! (Updated)
customer_reviews.text: New Review as of 10/24/19: I love this headset so much! I really missed it when I had to RMA it since the microphone failed. It is comfortable, reliable, and the audio sounds great. The wireless is a lot better than any other option I have tried and I get great range. My friends and I all have this headset and we love it. Corsair has some of the best customer support than any other manufacturer I have contacted. OLD REVIEW: The microphone has stopped working and it randomly says "Mic On, Mic Off" and it is really annoying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, convenient but had charging issues
customer_reviews.text: I use this for streaming and i really loved it until it just stopped charging . It breaks my heart it’s the most comfortable and convenient headphones I’ve ever had and I’ve only had it for a year or less than a year when i had to get a different one . I think the charging port got loose because i have to like push it down and hold it to charge but it shouldn’t be doing that ! Is there a way i can exchange or return it ? I just don’t have the $$$ to get a new one right now :(
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Great for big heads!
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble finding a headset for my big ol' head. This one fits great, even on the smallest setting, so that may be a drawback if your head is smaller than my gigantic 23.5" noggin. The earcups are nice and deep and I don't feel them on my ears. The headset itself is rather light, so you can wear it for a long time with little fatigue. The charging cord is nice and long, so if you need to charge while wearing, you can do so easily with a front usb port on your tower.
customer_reviews.author: Jen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Mich Better than Turtle Beach.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had Turtle Beach headphones that I thought were super nice with the leather pads and all, but these really top it. I felt like these breath a lot better (duh Leather didn’t breath) and have intuitive design and the mic movement is great with the ability to mute simply by moving the mic up. These are much better than any headphones I have had and we’re cheaper too.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: I did good.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a boyfriend birthday present. I was nervous about getting them cause he’s crazy picky about headphones. But he loves them and say that he loves that he can just flip the mic up to mute. He’s used them for about 2 months with no problems. They don’t pick up my tv noise. Or the baby. He says they’re nothing like his Bose $400 headphones Comfort wise. But there still nice he can go anywhere in the house and still hear. And they cancel Noise pretty well. Maybe a little too good.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for about 6 months, Then started smoking. Maybe you'll get a non-SMOKING pair
customer_reviews.text: Headset has/had great sound and features but smoking wasn't listed on the Amazon description. Used it daily for 6 months and was totally happy until today when it started smoking while charging...luckily I was at my desk and unplugged it (I do wonder what would have happened if I hadn't been home...). I was using the USB cable it came with that I had been using to charge it for the last 6 months in the same USB slot on my PC and had no problems. Hopefully you don't get a pair that catches fire! Via con dios.
customer_reviews.author: Justen D Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Slides off the front of my head at times. A person with a larger head might not have that problem
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable headset I’ve ever worn it doesn’t have a retractable mic like most headphones you just have to push it up out of the way it took quite a bit of tweaking to get it to sound like how I like my headphones to sound but for $80 what can you say it does the job My headphones before I bought these were razor Man’ owar wireless they were much more comfortable better sound quality and had a retractable Mic but they were bulky and big on my head and I didn’t like that
customer_reviews.author: Philburt

customer_reviews.title: My Girlfriend Hates These
customer_reviews.text: Multiple times has my girlfriend come into the room and instantly looked disgusted with me because she'd been screaming at me for minutes. The noise cancelling on these is absolutely nuts. Mic is another great feature to these. When you put the mouth piece up it will automatically mute your mic. Which is helpful when my girl gets to yelling lol Comfortable as well, sides adjust up and down and the ability to fold inward let's you lay the headphones down on the table flat
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Benson

customer_reviews.title: iCUE software sucks, but the headphones are decent sound quality and super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: All supporting softwares suck, not the fault of Corsair. That's just part of the industry. There's no money in it, so they don't put too much effort into their GUIs. This is my third pair of VOIDs. This pair was an upgrade from a gen 1 pair of wired VOIDs that I bought when I first built my PC. I can't recommend them enough. I even bought a pair for my workplace. I work T2 help desk, so having comfortable headphones is really great for long days.
customer_reviews.author: JoeB846

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless headset for the price. Surprisingly good at cancelling outside noise even though these are not noise cancelling. Very comfortable and sound quality is good. The pad on the top of the headset is a downside, as this is just a rectangular piece of foam in what should have been a rounded mesh pad. This make the headset feel a little cheaper, when they could have used a custom foam piece and made it a 5 star for the price headset.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: I basically ordered the wrong one thinking I was getting the corded version. Well to my surprise this thing even has excellent quality even several rooms away. I was playing Ring of Elysium and had to dip for a mid game trip to the loo. I crouched down and left my player as camo'd as possible in some brush. I was able to do the pinch and spray using a bidet I installed 6 months back, all without fear that anyone had discovered my character. Thanks Corsair, you're the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Albertson

customer_reviews.title: Great for Support Center Calls
customer_reviews.text: Wear this 10-11 hours a day taking calls and always comfortable. Although heavy, it feels light on the head due to design and padding. The “leans forward” headband also has a lot to do with this. Padding is fabric and not plastic so there’s no irritation and stickiness while wearing for hours. Battery has lasted 14 hours. I work in tech support and use this linked to Skype with Office365 Lync that is coordinated by our CIC system. Works fine. Range is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Decent Headset
customer_reviews.text: I like the range and sound quality coming in from the speakers. The voice quality with the mic is....well....just okay. It's not fantastic, but the freedom to be able to get up and do things without having to leave a voice channel makes up for this big time! Be warned it does sit fairly loosely on the head. Much better than my turtle beach wireless headset. Do yourself a favor and turn off that led light on the side when you go into the program for the first time. It wastes your battery life tremendously! After that, prepare for long hours of ear candy!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wall

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my husband biggest problem is that ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband biggest problem is that the station we got with it doesn't work well and sometimes doesn't charge it and the mic sometimes doesn't re trigger between turning it on and off bringing from up and down which really bothers my husband when he is gaming or talking to our friends over the internet.
customer_reviews.author: E.A.G.

customer_reviews.title: One Major Flaw, but overall a nice comfortable headset.
customer_reviews.text: The headset is awesome and very comfortable. The battery seems to last a fair bit. The sound is pretty good and I find myself not needing it to be maxed out with volume. Been playing Hellsblade, with the voices in her head whispering around my ears really adds an indepth immersive experience with this headset. Lighting is able to match with their keyboard and mouse. The one major flaw is that my computer won't have any sound with the usb doggle plugged in even if the headset is off.
customer_reviews.author: armyofsquirrels

customer_reviews.title: Buyer regret
customer_reviews.text: It is a sad day having to write this review. After purchasing this headset I was happy when it arrived. The design and comfort are very good for the price. However, the software component that is required to set up and configure headset specific settings is terrible. The iCue software would not even load after a fresh install. After finding 5 years of forum complaints and taking the time to troubleshoot with the provided guides I decided it was time to return. Thank you Corsair for your CPU cooling solutions and power supplies, but please improve your software situation for your wireless headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Knight

customer_reviews.title: Dont know how I lived without it for so long
customer_reviews.text: I've had this headset for about a year now. Sound quality is the best I've had, and oh boy is wireless amazing. I recently lost my dongle and had to resort to my old headset and I can't tell you how amazing wireless is. The customer service is the best I've experienced probably ever. I told them that I had lost my dongle to connect to the wireless and they sent me a replacement for free! And I received it 4 days after I submitted my ticket. I promise you will not regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Sloan Wernli

customer_reviews.title: it's OK, but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - comfortable, nice fit. - sound quality is good. - decent battery life (last most of the day) CONS: - mic positioning doesn't go low enough, can pickup on exhaling from nose. - appears to have issues with recent discord builds, often times you need to rejoin channel for voice to work, never happened with my logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Bananas

customer_reviews.title: The system is good, the software sucks
customer_reviews.text: Two things I dislike about this and both deal with software, at 100% volume on their end and mine, my teammates say it sounds like I am whispering, and there are three presents for the quality you cannot change it. Both of these things make this PRO RGB worthless. I would return it but I threw out the box trusting CORSAIR products, I won't make that mistake again.
customer_reviews.author: Remmy Meggs

customer_reviews.title: Fit comfortably and felt sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Received the headset and was stoked to use it. Fit comfortably and felt sturdy, however, when I plugged in the USB stick there was no light blink and my PC did not detect it. I tried the ports that worked too and nothing -- Looks like I'm going to have to return something since the wireless USB stick is shot. EDIT: Restarted PC and replugged in USB several times and it is now working. -1 star cause pain in the ass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, and I'm loving the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset for the combination of quality and color scheme. So far, I've been impressed by the appearance, the comfort, AND the sound. I'm glad I decided to ante up a bit from the mountain of <$40 "never heard of it"-branded headsets on Amazon. It's so pretty I decided to use it to test my product photography.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Weird Fit
customer_reviews.text: They are comfy and sound is good, but the fut is so weird. I'm a girl with maybe a smaller head? And they fit sort of loose on the ears; very different than the previous pair I owned. These tend to hang on the tops of my ears which becomes uncomfortable after about 2 hours. Will likely be returning.
customer_reviews.author: ImBusyRightNow

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gaming, Not so much for Music
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great set of headphones; microphone included. Audiophiles, look elsewhere. I was looking for a great gaming headset that didn't break the bank and delivered a quality sound. These significantly lack bass tones, and sit awkwardly on your head. When you get them into a comfortable position and need to use the microphone, that will sit in your line of sight and become distracting. Great price, clear gaming audio output and input, and can be worn for several hours without fatigue, so for that I give it three stars. The remaining two stars are lost due to music quality, wearing position, and control fumbling.
customer_reviews.author: Masonitech

customer_reviews.title: The most uncomfortable headset design...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure who's head these headphones were designed for, but i'm convinced it is for beings how heads are caved in by 45 degrees. They will fall off unless you keep your head perfectly straight and upright. If you look down these things will fly right off on their own. It has decent sound quality, but just about what you'd expect not next level quality. Not the headset for competitive games that's for sure. The wireless feature is the best part. Long charges, and an acceptable connection range. If I had to make this purchase again, I would by something more expensive. Overtime this thing just won't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Williams

customer_reviews.title: Still works perfect after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: No noise cancellation. But mine still work after 3 years. Battery life still lasts around 8+ hours. The mic snapped piece(because of my own fault), but a little super glue around the broken part and it works just like it came out of the box. Quality product, good price. 360 sound is pinpoint. Lacking in the bass department, but let's be honest. Who needs deep bass when gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but not for PS4
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use with a PS4. Incredibly light,, comfortable and well constructed. So light that they give you the impression they're falling off, or floating away. for being as light as they are, they seemed to be very well crafted, so well that I could see no weak spots that would wear and break over prolonged use. Waaaaay too good for a PS4, which doesn't recognize 7.1 surround or even 5.1, but a great choice for PC use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Stone

customer_reviews.title: A unique headset
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality sound. I am no expert but they are very similar in quality to the Arctis 7 as a reference. Generally they are very comfortable, but opposed to other headphones - most weight sits on your head instead of pressuring your ears. Might be very comfortable for some people but as a result noise cancellation is minimal. Connectivity wise they only work with the provided USB dongle, so you're not gonna listen to music from your phone with these. Aside from these the overall gaming/movie watching/music listening experience was superb.
customer_reviews.author: yaniv

customer_reviews.title: Left Ear Going To ****
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's a loose wire or what, but at one point moving my jaw would make a crackling sound. Now when my friend talks I hear a different kind of crackling half the time, and this is a new issue. I've had the headset maybe 4 months, I don't drop it or manhandle it. So I'd call it a faulty piece of junk, and I probably won't buy anymore logitech headsets, that's for sure. I also want to state that while my head may not be super small, the headset fits a bit too loosely on my head, so be weary of that.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Headset
customer_reviews.text: Only dislike was the padding on the top where it sits on my head. It’s really soft, but it doesn’t feel like it had all of it put it. The fabric is real loose. Other than that I haven’t had much of a problem with battery life it last 8-10 hour sessions without dying. And when it does get low the chords long enough for me to just plug it in and still keep playing.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Sending it back
customer_reviews.text: This device failed frequently from the beginning. Often, I would be streaming, and nobody could hear me. Or sometimes, the music I was listening to would just stop (but only for me, not for my viewers). I tried to get Corsair tech support, but their only option was to email them and wait for a response (no opportunity to get on the phone and attempt to diagnose it). Now, it is transmitting as if I'm talking through a fan...every half second, it doesn't transmit. I'm so glad I got the extended warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin G

customer_reviews.title: Good sound/mic quality but too many operating issues
customer_reviews.text: Have had this headset for a little over a year now, the first few months it was great headset. Pretty quickly the mic began to ware and had trouble staying up enough causing it to mute/unmute a bunch. About a half a year into owning it, started running into issues with connection, especially discord. Friend with this headset also has same connection issues. Now it's impossible for it to hold a charge and if I wear it while its charging there is a constant buzzing noise in the left ear. When it's working though it does have nice sound and mic quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: BAD CHARGING PORT, DON'T BU?Y
customer_reviews.text: This is the LAST wireless headset I'm ever buying.... First it was the ManOWar, at least that lasted over a year... But this thing's port is horrible! Every time I go to game it's "LOW BATTERY" Oh because the connection was terrible... I have to wiggle it in there and hope it stays to charge. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: It was good, but it was not charging from the first day
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the headphone sent to me was defective. It was working, but when I tried to charge it, it just turned off and kept not charging. I really liked how the headphone looks like and wanted to get a replacement and give it another try, but the return of the item became so complicated, so I changed my mind. I will find another headphone that works from the first time.
customer_reviews.author: iSimzZz

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome, sounds terrible
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and comfort are excellent. CUE software is clunky but usable. sound quality is very disappointing. Bass is muddled, range feels squished, and generally things sound weak. I'm not a huge audiophile, but have a few good points of reference with some high end headphones, primarily sony, audio technicas, sennheiser etc. Even these cheap Kotion's that I was hoping to replace sound WAAAAAYYYY better for games, movies, tv, music, etc. Way more clarity and range.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: These new PRO headphones are a step down in audio quality from the older Corsair Void headset
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these, upgrading from the older Corsair Void wireless headset. This PRO headset is a big step down in audio quality from my old Corsair Void headset that I had bought 2 years ago. I only upgraded on account of my charging jack becoming loose and it affecting it's ability to charge. I have the EQ presets the exact same on both head sets and I switched back and forth listening to the same thing and the old headset had a much crisper playback. It makes me so upset because I loved my old set and wanted these new ones to be at least the same or better.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Klassen

customer_reviews.title: which I'd like to do to make the battery last longer
customer_reviews.text: I can't use the Corsair software with this. The windows driver is installed, so the Corsair software won't detect it. I can't find a way to remove the Windows driver and install the Corsair driver, so I can't turn off the LED, which I'd like to do to make the battery last longer. The Corsair forums weren't any help. Otherwise the headset works well and sounds good, but if I'd known about this issue, I would have bought a different headset.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Great! But needs more tightness adjustment levels
customer_reviews.text: I switched from razer and love the quality of this headset but, I’m so sad that it doesn’t fit me well. At the tightest setting it is loose and can fall off my head if I look down to find the cheetah I dropped :/ Besides that- sound is wonderful and so is the mic quality. Looks great with my setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit for a woman's head
customer_reviews.text: They sat on top of my ears snugly. At my earlobe they stuck out away from my head. I wish a headset company would notice women are playing and paying ... not to mention children. I would like to find a LIGHT headset that fits smaller heads. I wish they would stop adding weight to give headsets a more "substantial quality feel" Lighter and tighter fit would be better imo! I am open to suggestions on a lighter smaller wireless headset with noise cancellation . This journey has been 3 for 3 in the disappointment column.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave as a Christmas gift to my hubs!
customer_reviews.text: So a friend actually recommend this product to me to gift to my husband. The headset it self is comfortable, and overall a great product. It’s use is suppose to mostly be for PC HOWEVER it can be used for PS4, when using on PS4 you control the sound volume from the PS settings itself not from the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, well made, somewhat loose fit.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really love this headset. Its range is fantastic and the sound quality for videos and gaming is superb. The only issue I've run into with this headset is the fit is somewhat loose. Even with the ability to change between sizes the fit has never felt truly secure to my head. For example when I lean my head forward looking at the ground or when I look up towards the ceiling I can feel the headset slightly move forward and backward. I still would recommend this headset for its sound quality and price point for a wireless headset.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Lally

customer_reviews.title: Music cuts out
customer_reviews.text: Update: Okay, I think I know what's going on with this thing. The sound cuts out, not randomly, but apparently in response to certain musical tracks in video games. Certain pitches must be causing it to cut out. This is a dealbreaker since this happens during many games. I might contact support if I find time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headset for work and gaming wirelessly!
customer_reviews.text: There is no other headset in the market right now that gives the quality and functionality of Corsair Void Pro RGB! I bought this headset to have my work phone calls when working from home and the audio quality from the microphone and headphones audio es excellent. There is no other product in the market that offers this. Plantronics and Logitech just stopped to build devices like this.
customer_reviews.author: Ed S

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First unit was DOA. Quick call to Corsair for troubleshooting (their tech support is actually dang good) and Amazon sent me a new one. Sounds great, comfortable, decent battery life. My only complaint is if you mute yourself, the mic feedback (replaying your voice through the ears; like a ‘monitor’ I suppose) does not unmute. More an annoyance than anything; just hold mute until it tones, then repeat and it’s back.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Only had it for a day but...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I have only had it for a day so I am not giving it 5 stars yet. But my boyfriend has this headset too and he has used it well for two years (it still works, btw). I got one because all of the wired headsets I use go bad quickly. I love how it's wireless, so I don't have to worry about a wire going bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought these thinking that the higher price would translate to good quality, but was mistaken. The headset had terrible audio quality, almost like the sound was coming from a 15 year old cell phone. It also dramatically reduced audio quality for my voice over the microphone, with no way to fix it. I even reached out to CORSAIR's support team to see what I could do (thinking maybe there was a driver missing or something) but they just said no, that's how its supposed to sound. This headset would be fine if it cost $20, but it in no way is worth what they are charging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has gone through multiple headsets. He’s very picky about sound quality, noise cancellation, and game vs chat audio controls. Well I guess this one met all his expectations because it’s been a few months and he hasn’t bought another brand. Thanks for making my grumpy gamer happy!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Crosby

customer_reviews.title: great but not for small heads, price changes drastically
customer_reviews.text: be sure to wait till the price is low, it changes from $98 today to $69 next day, great PC headset, Doesn't work with Xbox one X, I don't recomend it for small heads or girls, doesn't get the best of the sound quality because it gets losely at the bottom side of the cushions (you can try to bend it carefully so it gets tighter because it has a metal band inside)
customer_reviews.author: Panamá

customer_reviews.title: Popular with teens.
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift for my 17y gamer son. He loves them. He is on Discord regularly and raids in WoW. He's had no complaint. He loves that he can leave his room and go to the kitchen to raid the fridhe and take his friends with him. Lol I know the noise cancellation is great because he never hears a thing outside of his headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Branham

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, disable auto shutoff in settings
customer_reviews.text: Great design, fit, comfort, audio/mic quality, ease of use, and battery life. My only complaint with this device initially was the battery, but I realized that it had an auto shutoff feature in the settings that I overlooked. It's kind of annoying to me that auto shutoff only has one option of 5 minutes, and it is selected by default. It would be better to have multiple auto-off time options.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Headset, worth buying if you're into wireless.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, I love the way these feel on me, they're so comfortable and just ooze with quality. The only issues are the battery life if you forget to turn it off, and that the adjustable length for head sizes does sometimes expand when you use it for long periods just due to use, but once you readjust it there's no problems. In terms of staying on your head, the only way it'll fall off is If you move your head down and look at the floor for a long period or lean your head back for a long period. Otherwise it'll stay on nicely, with only minor adjustments in long play sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: souround sound works great but dosen't fit my head very wel
customer_reviews.text: sound quality is good but lacks any real bass. ive always been told i have a prety big head but this slides around on my head ALOT even on the smallest setting battery life is ok, probably about 12 hours on full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for a couple months now and I’m really enjoying them. They’re lightweight and the sound quality is excellent. Wireless range isn’t as good as my Logitech G930’s that they replaced, but I really have no need to have them on downstairs when the receiver is upstairs connected to the PC anyway so no loss of stars there. CUE software is pretty sweet. The only change I’d personally like is a wheel for the volume instead of the switch they have. Again, this is just personal preference most likely due to using the G930’s for so long. I would recommend them to anyone unless you have a need to be far from the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect.
customer_reviews.text: this is it. THE wireless headset. I work remote, do a lot of video conferencing, my share of gaming and I blast the occasional tunes. The corsair software that allows you to alter the EQ is really nice. You can create your own EQ presets, and the ones that are already there are actually pretty good. There is a "Stereo" button that will turn into Dolby if you click it. Make sure you click it. It makes a difference. I do not consider myself to have a small head, but they do feel a bit loose. It's ok, They feel very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CG dude

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Headset...but
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazingly comfortable. I love the white colored ones. There is just one thing these could do better, and for me, that is the sound on them sounds muffled a bit. Almost a deep sound. I tried running the software from corsair and tweaking but it still does not fix the problem. Overall, i'd give these a 4/5.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: It worked briefly
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice product, lit up, worked briefly. I give it 2 stars because that was it, too inconsistent performance. Maybe it was my system but the audio would cut in and out. If when it was working and wanted to hear audio through speakers or disconnect, would not reconnect if I wanted to play through headphones. I suppose if this product were to operate at peak performance, you must have 3.1 usb. I have standard 2.0 and 3.0. The other issue was the stand I bought with wouldn't stay connected via usb either. There was a issue with usb 3.0 operating on or interference on the 2.4 GHz band; and also discussed on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Great headset, one of the best by far especially ...
customer_reviews.text: Great headset, one of the best by far especially in the wireless domain. The power on to connected and ready to go delay can feel long. One hassle is if the microphone is flipped up before turning off and you flip it down before it's fully powered on it will not enable, you will need to raise and lower the microphone again after it's powered up.
customer_reviews.author: Derek J. Nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for just over 3 months now and they are still fantastic! They hold a charge for 12-14 hours of use before I need to charge them again and the range is really awesome! I would definitely recommend these for the price if you’re looking for a wireless gaming headset! The only thing that I could see bothering some people is that if you’re moving your head around a lot, these might slip off, but it doesn’t bother me at all!
customer_reviews.author: Bryanna W

customer_reviews.title: Look for something different.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m not happy with my purchase. The battery life on these things are horrible, mic stop working. the little usb plug in thing to use headphones is extra fragile, which caused it to break very easy, making my headphones useless. Also wearing this made my ears very hot. Will say though the padding in the bridge path that sits on top of your head is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They work better than anything I have used before and I use a lot of headphone item because I am partially deaf These headphones feel more comfortable and fit over ear to drown out outside interference. With the mic attached and auto shutoff when you swing the mic boom up it makes them perfect for streaming.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY

customer_reviews.title: Buggy
customer_reviews.text: Had to look up a lot of information on it. Started out working fine and haven't owned it that long. The voice in the headset will randomly auto initiate a shutdown while i'm using it, or beep randomly. Even with the icue app it doesn't let me completely turn off the light on the side of the headset (it used to, i would keep it off completely so it didn't drain the battery). Now it's a permanent blue light. Just wouldn't recommend these and I wish i hadn't purchased it so long ago so I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: Nautical

customer_reviews.title: After research Just got my 3rd pair - very happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a gamer family. Three teenage sons. All teenage gamer. Every birthday or so, one of them requests a new gamer headset. Well it's Oct 2018, and after doing my research this headset is still in the right value/cost zone. Have two other sets going strong with heavy daily use. This is the set to buy, very happy with the other two sets we own.
customer_reviews.author: JP Vic

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to charge, doesn't last as long as claimed. Half the time it's wired as a result of the battery life and charge time. Sounds and mic is fine but that's baseline. If plugged into the headset stand (same brand) and it's low on battery, it makes an annoying beeping noise. Plug it into the computer and nothing. Not as comfortable as my game ones, not particularly good for long gaming sessions. Not bad for the price but spending a little more on senheisers is worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good and comfortable, terrible mic.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is very good and the range lets me walk around my 1300 square foot house without any interruptions. They feel fairly comfortable and have worn them for six hour long sessions no problem. The mic is fairly garbage like most "gaming headsets" so if the mic quality is something you are worried about, get a dedicated mic to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: These are well worth the $!
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless headset. I switched to this headset from the Razer Man-o-wars. This headset is more comfortable for extended gaming, has a longer battery life, and the audio quality is noticeably better. The Mic quality is not quite as good as Razer, but these are a lot less expensive. Corsair's software is not as polished as Razer's too. The Void's build quality beats the Razer's hands down. These aree well worth the $100.
customer_reviews.author: Leeskiie

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt charge. RIP headset
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a while! The fit was great. Sound and mic quality was also fantastic. Then suddenly it stopped charging. I tried several charger wires and it wont charge. I havent had it for very long and I dont use it excessively. Guess this is an issue when it comes to wireless headsets.
customer_reviews.author: StephyG

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Microphone
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really liked these headphones. They fit comfortably on my head, they looked cute, and I loved that they were wireless. Sound quality was just okay, but the biggest issue was the microphone. We got complaints from friends that it sounded like we were taking through a 20s radio and that we were just unbearable to listen to. For that reason mainly, we had to return.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life does not meet my expectations. It definitely doesn't get any where near 16 hours, more realistically around 6 hours of combined usage. Sound quality is pretty good for the price; the surround sound is definitely spot on. Overall, despite the poor battery life I would definitely recommend this headset to anyone on a budget. I use it mostly for Player Unknown's Battle Grounds so I can determine direction of enemy fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Corsair Void Pro RGB Wireless Gaming Headset - Dolby 7.1 Surround Sound Headphones for PC - Discord Certified - 50mm Drivers - White
product_meta.description: The VOID PRO RGB Wireless headset provides exceptional comfort, epic audio performance, and legendary CORSAIR durability to deliver the ultimate gaming experience. Microfiber mesh fabric and memory foam ear cups let you play for hours while providing airflow and comfort. Enjoy the precision of custom tuned 50mm speaker drivers and an all new noise canceling microphone for crystal clear communication. Advanced 2.4Ghz wireless technology delivers up to 40ft range, up to 16 hours of battery life and Dolby Headphone 7.1 surround sound. RGB lighting control and CUE software enable virtually unlimited color options and syncing with other CORSAIR RGB devices.
feature_bullets: Microfiber mesh fabric and memory foam provide exceptional comfort. Connector USB Type A

Legendary CORSAIR build quality ensures long term durability. Frequency Response: 20Hz 20 kHz. Sensitivity: 38dB (+/ 3dB). While charging, the LEDs on InfoMic will light up. Depending on the battery levels the LED will light up different colors red: low battery, amber: 20percentage or higher, green: fully charged
Custom tuned 50mm neodymium speaker drivers bring the action to life with wide range and accuracy. Microphone Frequency Response: 100Hz to 10kHz
Enjoy crystal clear, low latency, wireless audio with up to 40ft range and up to 16 hours of battery life
Optimized unidirectional microphone with LED mute indicator reduces ambient noise for enhanced voice quality. Easily stowed and muted by pushing up and out of the way
Compatibility:PC with USB port,Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7,Internet connection (for CUE software download)
The CORSAIR VOID PRO RGB WIRELESS headset provides exceptional comfort, epic audio performance and legendary CORSAIR durability to deliver the ultimate gaming experience
Play with the confidence that your microphone and audio drivers have been tested and evaluated for crystal clear communication and outstanding sound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,705 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
